name: Candidate Evaluation
description: Evaluate software engineering candidates based on educational pedigree, company pedigree, trajectory, and technical skills

questions.helpText: Would you recommend this candidate for a software engineering role?

• Bachelor's degree is strongest signal
• Selectivity/prestige of undergrad weighted most
• Top-tier CS/Eng bachelor's = Great
• Mid-tier bachelor's = Average/Weak
• Graduate degrees add value only if top school
• Top-tier MS in CS/Eng = Good/Great
• Mid-tier MS not strong signal
• PhD in CS/Eng = Good, top-tier = Great/Excellent
• Technical majors favored

• Brand and caliber of employers
• Tier-1 tech companies
• High-growth startups
• Selective teams
• Notable acquisitions

• Speed/consistency of promotions vs years
• >8 years → should be ≥ Senior SWE
• >12 years → should be ≥ Staff SWE
• Faster = stronger, slower = weaker

• Confirm titles are SWE
• Confirm responsibilities are SWE

rendering.customCSS: .candidate-header { background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea, #764ba2); padding: 1.5rem; border-radius: 0.75rem; margin-bottom: 1rem; } .pedigree-rating { display: inline-block; padding: 0.25rem 0.75rem; border-radius: 0.375rem; font-weight: 600; } .rating-exceptional { background: #10b981; color: white; } .rating-strong { background: #3b82f6; color: white; } .rating-good { background: #8b5cf6; color: white; } .rating-average { background: #f59e0b; color: white; } .rating-weak { background: #ef4444; color: white; }

iclFormat.systemPrompt: You are an expert technical recruiter evaluating software engineering candidates.
